summary: This is an internal email chain from July 2019 among investigators summarizing interviews conducted with victims and witnesses following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. It details allegations of sexual abuse and recruitment of minors, as well as Epstein's operational patterns involving massages.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation, accused of sexually abusing multiple minor girls and young women, often during massages at his properties in New York, Florida, and the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Interview of Victim in New York
events.description: A woman was interviewed in New York. She alleged that in 2001, at age ~14, she was befriended and recruited by another young woman to Epstein's house, where she was enticed to provide nude massages for $300. In fall 2002, Epstein raped her during a massage.

events.title: Interview of Victim in Florida
events.description: A woman was interviewed in Florida. She alleged that in 2002, at age 14, a friend recruited her to give Epstein a massage at his Palm Beach house, during which he touched her breasts and genitals. She also recruited another minor girl for Epstein.

events.title: Second Interview of Victim in Florida
events.description: Another woman was interviewed in Florida. She alleged that in the early 2000s, at age 16 or 17, a friend recruited her to give Epstein massages at his Palm Beach house. She was sexually abused during at least two massages.

events.title: Interview of Former Assistant in New York
events.description: A former assistant to Epstein was interviewed in New York. She worked for him from early 2005 to early 2006, scheduling his daily massages. She described two groups of massage providers: professional masseuses and young, non-professional girls, some of whom were minors. She also described having coercive, potentially nonconsensual sexual encounters with Epstein.

events.title: Interview of Victim in Florida
events.description: A woman was interviewed in Florida. She met Epstein in 2007 at age 17. After turning 18, she began giving him massages involving sexual abuse. Epstein later raped her on his private island. She had multiple sexual encounters with him between 2007-2009, some nonconsensual. Epstein paid her $10,000 in ~2013 to marry another girl for immigration purposes.

events.title: Alleged Rape of Minor
events.description: A victim alleges that in fall 2002, while massaging Epstein, he asked her to get on top of him and then raped her without consent despite her protests.

events.title: Former Assistant's Employment
events.description: A woman worked as Epstein's assistant, scheduling his daily massages. She became aware his massages were sexual and that he maintained two distinct groups of girls for them.

events.title: Series of Abuse and Coercion
events.description: A victim, who met Epstein at 17, describes a pattern of abuse beginning after she turned 18, including rape on his private island and multiple sexual encounters, some nonconsensual.

events.title: Paired Marriage for Immigration
events.description: Epstein paid a victim $10,000 to marry another girl so that girl could stay in the U.S. The marriage lasted about four years.

keyFacts: Epstein maintained a system of two distinct groups of girls for massages: professional masseuses for his friends, and young, non-professional girls (some minors) for himself.
Multiple victims allege being recruited as minors (ages 14-17) by friends to give Epstein massages, which escalated to sexual abuse and rape.

A former assistant, who also had coercive encounters with Epstein, was responsible for scheduling his expected two daily massages (morning and afternoon) and identified signs the girls were minors (e.g., needing SAT prep, talking about school).
One victim alleges Epstein paid her $10,000 around 2013 to marry another girl for immigration purposes, a marriage that lasted about four years.
The document is an internal investigative summary created shortly after Epstein's July 2019 arrest, showing active witness/victim interviews were underway in New York and Florida.
